overview: Larry brings 30 years of senior executive management and finance experience in technology and services industries. Prior to founding .406, Larry served on the board of 14 companies, including 5 public and 9 venture-backed companies. Larry is on the board of portfolio companies Ambient Devices, ChosenSecurity, Optaros, RatePoint, Mashery, and ThingMagic. Prior to founding .406, Larry served as Chief Financial Officer of ThingMagic, the leading provider of RFID reader solutions, where he managed the companyâ€™s successful $19 million equity financing. Between 2000 to 2004, he served initially as Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and then as a Director of CCBN.com, which facilitated online communication between public companies and the investment community, where he played a major role in the companyâ€™s sale to Thomson Financial for $150 million. Prior to that, he was Executive Vice President, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer of i-Cube and Razorfish, where he oversaw revenue growth from $9 million to $41 million in three years, awarding the i-Cube IPO â€œMassachusetts IPO of 1998â€ and the companyâ€™s ultimate sale to Razorfish for $1.8 billion in 1999 . From 1988 to 1996 Larry served as Partner, Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer of The Boston Consulting Group. He holds an MBA-Finance from Babson College and a BSBA-Accounting from Boston College.
